content.context: 死亡玩家：6号玩家、9号玩家
I am a law-abiding villager. Players 6 and 9 are dead, but I didn't do it. I think it was someone who spoke after me. Whoever did it, please confess!

Hello everyone, I'm a diligent villager. Last night, players 6 and 9 were eliminated. I believe the Witch was killed by the werewolves and could only prove her identity by using the poison. I hope the Seer in the later positions will speak well. I will choose which side to support based on their statements.

I am a villager. Last night, both No. 6 and No. 9 died, which leads me to believe that one of them was the witch who was killed. The witch would only use her poison when her own life is threatened, to prove her identity. The early speakers, No. 2 and No. 3, both claimed to be villagers. Since neither of them claimed any special roles, I tentatively consider them both to be good people. I hope the seer in the later speaking positions can make a good statement. I will choose which side to support based on their speech and logic, and cast my valuable vote accordingly.

Up to now, with player 5 having spoken, no one has claimed to be the Seer. If two players in later positions both claim to be the Seer, I will choose to support one based on their speeches and logic. If only one player claims to be the Seer, I suspect players 6 and 9 might be the Witch or werewolves. Perhaps the Witch was killed by werewolves and used her poison on a werewolf, making the remaining werewolves afraid to pretend to be the Seer. If players 6 and 9 are the Seer and Witch or Villager and Witch, seeing two good players eliminated, the werewolves might boldly claim to be the Seer. In this case, I will be more critical of the Seer's speech. If they fail to convince me, I might not support them. I can only hope that neither player 6 nor 9 is the real Seer.

The players in the early positions, numbers 2, 3, and 4, all claim to be villagers. I can clearly see that my own identity card is a villager. Could there really be four villager cards in this game? Therefore, I've concluded that among players 2, 3, and 4, there must be one werewolf! Player 5 hasn't stated their identity in their speech, so it seems like the only role left for you is a werewolf. You, number 5, are a werewolf card. I can't distinguish which one among players 2, 3, and 4 is the werewolf based on their speeches. There are still two players left to speak, and I hope the Seer will reveal themselves. If no one claims to be the Seer, I can only assume that the Seer was among the players who have already been eliminated! If no one claims to be the Seer in the remaining speeches, then I will vote for player 5, the werewolf, to be eliminated!

I am the Seer. Number 9 is a good identity, which I verified as they are next to me. Number 2 asked the werewolves to confess, but do you really think werewolves would admit their identity so easily? Number 2's speech is ridiculous and absurd, so I'm marking them as a werewolf. Number 4 simply believes that 2 and 3 are good people just because they didn't pretend to be the Seer, which is even more absurd than Number 2's speech. Following your logic, Number 4, you would label all players in later positions who didn't claim to be the Seer as good people, is that right?! Number 4, you even claim to choose sides based on speeches and logic. I almost fell over laughing when I heard that. Is your method of protecting people based on logic, Number 4? The werewolf suspects are Numbers 2 and 4. Today, if Number 1 doesn't pretend to be the Seer against me, let's vote for Number 4. I'm calling for votes on Number 4, but if Number 1 claims to be the Seer, then that's another story.

I'm a villager. No one has claimed to be the witch at my position, which suggests that either player 6 or 9 was the witch who was forced to use the poison to prove their identity after being attacked, killing the other player. The earlier speakers, players 2, 3, 4, and 7, all claimed to be villagers. I know I'm a villager, so there are 5 players claiming to be villagers. Excluding the possibility of the hunter pretending to be a villager to avoid being killed by werewolves, it's highly likely that two werewolves are among players 2, 3, 4, and 7!

I believe player 8 is the seer. If 8 were a werewolf pretending to be the seer, they could have easily declared me (player 1) as a bad identity, which would have been hugely beneficial for them. This way, 8 could either accurately challenge the real seer or establish themselves as the unopposed seer and vote out a good player. However, 8 declared the eliminated player 9 as a good identity, so I think 8 is the real seer.

Among the four players who claimed to be villagers earlier, I think players 2 and 7 are most likely werewolves. Player 2 started by saying that the deaths of 6 and 9 weren't their doing, but were caused by later players. This kind of speech makes me think that 2 is desperately trying to defend themselves! If you didn't cause the deaths of 6 and 9, then of course it must have been the later players, so why do you say you "think" it was the later players? I believe player 2's speech is too explosive, close to making mistakes during the speech!

Player 7 directly attacked player 5 as a werewolf just because 5 didn't reveal their identity. I don't understand this either. In a situation where two players died last night, shouldn't the special roles try to hide their identities? You, player 7, are nothing more than a villager or lower role!

I think player 2 is almost certainly a werewolf who made mistakes during their speech, and player 7 might be a werewolf. Player 2 seems more obviously a werewolf than player 7. I will vote for player 2 to be eliminated!

- **Player 2**: "Players 6 and 9 are dead, but I didn't do it. I think it was someone who spoke after me. Whoever did it, please confess!" I can't understand why a good person would make such a statement, so I believe Player 2 is a werewolf.

- **Player 4**: Player 4's speech is even more outrageous than Player 2's. Player 4 thinks that because Players 2 and 3 didn't claim any roles, they must both be good people. Following this logic, Player 4 should consider all players who didn't claim roles as good people. - 2 = 4

To avoid splitting the good team's votes and causing a scattered voting pattern, I've decided to vote for Player 2 this round.

In conclusion, I've decided to vote for Player 2.

content.context: 死亡玩家：8号玩家

I believe Player 1 is a werewolf. Player 1 forcefully redirected the vote from the uncontested Seer, Player 8, to Player 2. Seer 8 clearly stated to vote for Player 4, but Player 1 shifted the focus onto Player 2. Was Player 2 wrong to give a vague speech as the first speaker? This round, I will vote to eliminate Player 1 as a werewolf!

I am the Seer. On the first night, I verified that Player 9 has a good identity. Last night, I confirmed that Player 2 is a werewolf. Yesterday, I noticed Player 8 pretending to be a Seer and deliberately giving Player 9 a good identity to manipulate emotions. Since I wasn't at risk of being eliminated yesterday, I decided not to reveal my identity, as doing so could have led to my elimination. Unexpectedly, Player 8, the fake Seer, "committed seppuku" last night with a samurai sword to solidify their "Seer" identity. Well done, Player 8, you really had the guts to harm yourself! Players 2 and 8 are both werewolves. Player 7 strongly supports Player 8's fake Seer claim. Today, Player 7 is attacking me, the real Seer, claiming I'm a werewolf, which likely means Player 7 is also a werewolf charging in to support Player 8. The three werewolves on the field are Players 2, 7, and 8. Given that Player 8 sacrificed themselves last night, which actually helped us regain momentum, we should first eliminate Player 2, the confirmed werewolf, today. Tonight, I'll verify Player 7, and tomorrow we can justifiably eliminate them. The Hunter must hide well today. As long as you, Hunter, aren't killed tonight, the good team can win!

I can't believe this. Both the real and fake seers want to vote me out. Have I become the public werewolf? Is there any justice left? If that's the case, I believe the real seer is either the eliminated player 6 or 9, and both 8 and 1 who claimed to be seers are werewolves! Let's all vote for 1 today. Yesterday, 8 pretended to be a seer, why didn't you, 1, vote for 8 then? Isn't it a bit late for you, 1, to claim to be a seer today?

Surrender, good people! You're surrounded by werewolves. We three wolves are here. Put down your shovels, hoes, and pickaxes. We werewolves promise not to harm you if you cooperate! Now, our wolf team only needs to find the hunter and vote them out. This way, you villagers can avoid suffering. Of course, you know who the hunter is. If that good person speaks up, they'll be our "honored guest." If anyone withholds information, we'll unleash a massacre - sparing neither young nor old, not even chickens or calves! Numbers 1 and 7, stop pretending. We werewolves have already "turned the tables and are singing our victory song." Today, I'm voting for Number 5 to be eliminated. Last round, Number 5 didn't claim any role, so they're likely the hunter. Little hunter, you can't hide from us!

I'm a villager, and I believe the good side has no chance of winning now. Number 8 can only be the Seer who was killed during the night. Number 1 is the werewolf who changed votes last round and pretended to be a seer this round. Number 3 voted for me in both rounds, so they must also be a werewolf. Today, all good players should vote for Number 1 to be eliminated. Even if the outcome is decided, we shouldn't give up or lose hope. We must work together to drive the werewolves out of our village.

The werewolf positions have been identified: Numbers 1, 3, and 7 are the three werewolves. In the previous round, I voted for Number 7, but Numbers 2 and 4 ended up in a tie. Number 1 claimed that Number 8 is a werewolf. If Number 8 were indeed a werewolf, would they vote for their fellow werewolf Number 2 just because of Number 1's brief persuasion, especially when Number 4 had already been identified as a good player? Therefore, Number 1 can only be a werewolf! Yesterday, Number 7 claimed to be a villager and stated that among Numbers 2, 3, and 4, one is a werewolf. However, the villager positions have already been filled, so they concluded that Number 5 must be a werewolf, without mentioning that the good team still has three special roles. I believe Number 7 is a werewolf trying to find a good player to vote for. I am indeed the hunter, and the good team is likely beyond salvation. This round, as the hunter, I'm voting for Number 1, the werewolf.

In conclusion, I decide to vote for Player 2.
